info.name: Challange 5 - Auth Design Pattern
info.description: This collection contains API endpoints to manage cars and handle user authentication for the Binar Academy project. It includes endpoints for managing car records, user authentication (login, registration), and user role management (Member, Admin, Super Admin). The collection is structured according to an authorization design pattern, utilizing Bearer Tokens for secure access control and to restrict access to specific endpoints based on user roles.

response.name: 400 - Model, Brand, Year, Number, Price and Available are required

request.description: Allows admin and super admin to remove a car from the system.

item.description: Cars endpoints in this folder are designed for car data management.

request.description: Authenticates members, allowing them to log in to the system.
Enables new users to sign up and create a member account.

response.name: 400 - Password must be more than 6 char
500 - Validation error: Name cannot be empty

request.description: Retrieves information about the currently logged-in member using their Bearer Token.
Authenticates admin users, allowing them to access admin-specific functions.
Retrieves information about the currently logged-in admin.
Authenticates super admins, allowing access to all system functions.
Allows super admins to create new admin accounts.

response.name: 400 - Password must be more than 6 char

request.description: Retrieves information about the currently logged-in super admin.

item.name: System

request.description: Verifies that the API is operational and responsive.
Purpose unclear (may require additional details), potentially for handling lost resources or connectivity.

item.description: System-level endpoints to perform general health checks and handle other system-wide operations.
